item.title: Building Families
item.description: Whether your children are grown or still growing, opportunities to teach them truth will never run out. True success comes to parents who don’t let distractions get in the way of living gospel principles and teaching their children to do the same.

item.title: After the Storm
item.description: The day of the tornado, Maylene was ready to give up on a life that had completely overwhelmed her. She felt helpless. But after surviving the tornado that day, Maylene knew that she and her family could make it through anything with God’s help.

item.title: Lift
item.description: Jesus Christ set the ultimate example of selfless service. In this original short film, we meet people discovering the power of living that simple principle.

item.title: Bearing Our Burdens with Hope
item.description: Being happy does not always mean being without hardship. Sometimes it means just the opposite. That principle is brought to life in this story of a young husband who is only able to make it home safely after his load grows much heavier.

item.title: Obedience to the Ten Commandments
item.description: As children of God, we have been given the wonderful gift of choice. The truest happiness and peace we can have comes by choosing to obey His laws.

item.title: Family History: What I Found
item.description: Joe always loved his grandfather, but he didn’t know some of the most interesting things about him until a mysterious journal entry and a surprising wartime keepsake inspired Joe to learn more.

item.title: Protect Our Nestlings
item.description: We live in a very dangerous world that threatens those things that are most spiritual. The family is under attack from forces seen and unseen. We need to live in such a way that the adversary cannot steal into our homes.

item.title: The Refiner's Fire
item.description: The refiner’s fire is not a comfortable place to be. It involves intense heat and repeated hammering. But it is in the refiner’s fire we are purified and prepared to meet God.

item.title: Sitting on the Bench: Thoughts on Suicide Prevention
item.description: Suicidal thoughts are real and often begin when a person feels like the world would be better off without them. Sometimes, the most powerful tool to help someone is to simply reach out with friendship and words of love and encouragement.

item.title: You Never Know
item.description: Sometimes, the most important things you do each day are never even on your “to-do” list. You might worry about the things you never get done, but President Gordon B. Hinckley reminds us, “You never know how much good you do.”

item.title: Overcoming Pornography Addiction: The Healing Power of Jesus Christ
item.description: Pornography addiction is "a plague like we have never seen," but God knows about this and has provided an escape through the healing power of Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Hope of God's Light
item.description: Many of us have wondered if God knows us or if He even exists. Todd was someone who wasn’t surprised when he didn’t get an immediate answer to a prayer. But could God be giving us small but obvious answers? And how patient do we need to be?

item.title: True Christianity
item.description: When their best friend passes away, two men embark on an epic road trip to discover the meaning of “true Christianity.”

item.title: The Savior Wants to Forgive
item.description: A former addict and repeat convict shares his experiences with the Savior’s ability and willingness to forgive him again and again, even when he felt undeserving.

item.title: Bullying - Stop It
item.description: Dieter F. Uchtdorf counsels us that when it comes to hating, gossiping, ignoring, ridiculing, holding grudges, or wanting to cause harm—stop it!

item.title: The Other Prodigal Son
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland shares the story of the older brother of the prodigal son and reminds us that "no one of us is less treasured or cherished of God than another. He loves each of us—insecurities, anxieties, self-image, and all."

item.title: Abide with Me
item.description: How can you find true peace and comfort when change and confusion in the world becomes overwhelming? You can find solace by turning to God in prayer. Learn how the words from the hymn 'Abide with Me' can strengthen you during times of despair.

item.title: The Reason Behind Christmas
item.description: This Christmas season, give the gift Jesus Christ wants us to give; the gift of ourselves. Amid the shopping and commercialism, focus on the reason we're celebrating and remember to keep Christ in Christmas.

item.title: Leave the Party
item.description: John's life may have been very different had he not had the courage to leave a party one evening in Japan.

item.title: Wrong Roads
item.description: When making decisions, God expects us to pray, trust, and be believing and then not give up, panic, or "jump ship" when something doesn't seem to be going right.

item.title: Daily Bread: Experience
item.description: Sometimes in life, there is no where else to turn but to God. Elder D. Todd Christofferson shares a personal experience that taught him to truly pray, recognize answers to prayers, and take life one day at a time.

item.title: Daily Bread: Pattern
item.description: Just as we need daily physical sustenance, the need for daily spiritual sustenance is just as strong. We can remember Jesus Christ every day as we pray, read the scriptures, and meditate.

item.title: Daily Bread: Change
item.description: Jesus Christ is the bread of eternal life. By following Him, remembering Him, and having faith in Him we can change and become what we aspire to become.

item.title: A Secure Anchor
item.description: Just like rock climbing alone can be dangerous, living your life without the help of the Savior can have disastrous consequences.

item.title: Origin
item.description: The best way to find truth is to go to the origin, our Heavenly Father, and ask for inspiration through prayer.

item.title: Enduring Love
item.description: Watch how this couple demonstrates pure love and service in their marriage—even though they have to endure debilitating physical adversity.

item.title: A Mother's Hope
item.description: When President Uchtdorf was a young child, he learned that his mother was a great example of how hope and faith can overcome fear.

item.title: My Brother Hyrum
item.description: Learn about Hannah's relationship with her brother Hyrum who has autism, and how she exemplifies Christlike love. Everyone deserves to be loved and valued, no matter how different they are from you.

item.title: Having Children in Faith
item.description: It is a privilege for a husband and wife to be able to bear children. The decision on when to have children takes faith and is between the husband, wife, and the Lord.

item.title: Courage
item.description: Learn from the life of Esther and other inspiring women the importance of trusting in God and courageously standing up for what you believe.

item.title: Extraordinary Gift
item.description: Kuha'o, a blind 15-year-old piano prodigy, freely shares his God given musical gift to bless the lives of everyone who listens.

item.title: Mountains to Climb
item.description: Finding faith in the Lord Jesus Christ will help us have the power to endure and overcome even the hardest trials in life.

item.title: Earthly Father, Heavenly Father
item.description: Men on earth have the opportunity to become fathers and experience some of the same joys that our Heavenly Father feels for us. Fatherhood is a divine responsibility to be cherished.

item.title: Your Potential, Your Privileges
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf shares a humorous parable of a man who realizes he has been living far beneath his privileges.

item.title: Words with Friends
item.description: Learning, pondering, searching, and memorizing scriptures is like filling a filing cabinet with friends, values, and truths that can be called upon any time, anywhere in the world.

item.title: Waiting on Our Road to Damascus
item.description: Those who diligently seek to learn of Christ will eventually come to know Him. Read President Uchtdorf's full address here: http://bit.ly/gRCS4z

item.title: Your Day for a Mission
item.description: At 19, Sid Going was a shoo-in for New Zealand's national rugby team, but he chose to serve a mission first. Elder Neil L. Andersen tells why Sid made the decision and how the blessings of a mission outweigh any sacrifice.

item.title: The Will of God
item.description: God uses love-inspired correction to guide us to a future we do not or cannot now envision but which He knows is the better way for us.

item.title: Temples are a Beacon
item.description: No sacrifice is too great to obtain the blessings available in Holy Temples.

item.title: Stay within the Lines
item.description: Just as athletes must stay within lines to compete in sports, those who are called to labor in the Lord's work must stay within the lines of worthiness.

item.title: Sharing Your Beliefs
item.description: Use blogging, texting, and other forms of communication to share your testimony of the gospel to all the world.

item.title: Seminary Can Change Lives
item.description: A testimony is necessary to get through the difficult teenage years. President Thomas S. Monson teaches how seminary can help you build and strengthen that testimony. "Effort is required," he says. "But it is effort you will never, ever regret."

item.title: Saving Your Marriage
item.description: A marriage, like a human life, is a precious, living thing. Spouses should exercise faith in Christ and love for each other to heal and strengthen their relationship.

item.title: Rescued by Christ
item.description: British falconer George O'Neill shares the story of how he was rescued by Christ.

item.title: Reclaimed
item.description: Elder Shayne M. Bowen teaches: "The Atonement of Jesus Christ is available to each of us. It can clean, reclaim, and sanctify even you."

item.title: Power of God
item.description: The Priesthood is the power of God on Earth used to bless our lives and the lives of others.

item.title: Patterns of Light: The Light of Christ
item.description: What is light? In this three part series, Elder David A. Bednar discusses how we receive and perceive light from God. Part 1 centers on the properties of light and how the Light of Christ affects all men and women everywhere.

item.title: Patterns of Light: Discerning Light
item.description: How do we recognize divine light and discern it from our own thoughts? In part 2 of this three part series, Elder David A. Bednar discusses how to discern and act upon light from God.

item.title: Patterns of Light: Spirit of Revelation
item.description: What is the connection between light and revelation? In part 3 of this three part series, Elder David A. Bednar explains the patterns of light by which God communicates with us and how they lead to the spirit of revelation.

item.title: Love Her Mother
item.description: How can a father raise a happy, well-adjusted daughter in today's increasingly toxic world?

item.title: Looking through Windows
item.description: We should be careful how we judge others, as we may be looking at them through our own "unclean windows." Read President Monson's full address, "Charity Never Faileth" here: http://bit.ly/d8J2Lh

item.title: God Will Lift Us Up
item.description: Rather than focus on her medical condition, Brittany has found comfort in serving others and trusting in the Lord.

item.title: Fulfilling Your Duty to God
item.description: “When you make a goal in Duty to God, you’re making a commitment to your Heavenly Father that you’re going to do something. It’s your duty to Him.” (Marcus V., 17, Washington)

item.title: Eternal Truth
item.description: Family relationships can and will exist beyond the grave as families make and keep sacred ordinances and covenants in God’s holy temples.

item.title: Enemy Territory
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer shares an experience in which he was protected during World War II by listening to a prompting from the Spirit and promises youth that they will be protected if they "heed the promptings that come from the Holy Ghost."

item.title: Deep Beauty
item.description: Sister Elaine S. Dalton tells of how she learned as a young woman what true beauty means. As a young woman, you were born to be a queen.

item.title: Daughters of God
item.description: Latter-day Saint women from across the globe share how their God-given strengths allow them to impact the world.

item.title: Dare to Stand Alone
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson shares an experience he had in the Navy when he had to stand alone and reminds us that "we are never alone when we stand with our Father in Heaven."

item.title: 195 Dresses
item.description: Have you ever noticed how hard it is to find a modest prom dress? One young woman in Arizona came up with a solution for her community.

item.title: A Change of Heart
item.description: A young man in Honduras was drifting toward a life of apathy, selfishness, and trouble until a friend showed him he was born for so much more.

item.title: A Book of Mormon Story
item.description: A young bishop in England describes how the Book of Mormon came to life for him and changed his perspective forever.

item.title: A True Friend: Tanya and Lada
item.description: While doing what's right is not always popular, Tanya has become president of her school by being a true friend to those around her.

item.title: Book of Mormon: Messages from Heaven
item.description: President Monson and President Erying encouraged youth to read the Book of Mormon. Youth from Eastern Europe share what they have learned from reading the Book of Mormon and writing down their impressions.

item.title: Chastity: what are the limits?
item.description: Latter-day Saint teens are counseled to stay sexually pure, but what exactly are the limits? Using teachings of modern prophets, this presentation shows how we can find happiness and peace through staying chaste.

item.title: Child of God
item.description: Remember—through a beloved children's song—who you really are.

item.title: Dayton's Legs
item.description: A 13-year-old boy in Arizona fulfilled his Duty to God by pushing himself to the limit so that his friend, who has cerebral palsy, could participate with him in a triathlon.

item.title: Expressions of Love
item.description: Couples of all ages share the many ways they have found to express love for each other.

item.title: Flecks of Gold
item.description: This compelling story of an 1850s gold prospector illustrates how giving service to others blesses our lives.

item.title: He Will Give You Help
item.description: Faced with great pain and loss, a teen and his friends in Canada turn to God to find answers to their souls’ deepest questions.

item.title: His Sacred Name—An Easter Declaration
item.description: This Easter, remember the sacred name, life, and sacrifice of our Savior, Jesus Christ.

item.title: Honesty: You Better Believe It!
item.description: It is better to be honest than get a good score on a test.

item.title: I Choose to Be Pure
item.description: Six interfaith youth speak candidly on why they have chosen to be sexually pure.

item.title: Men's Hearts Shall Fail Them
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson shares a personal story to give encouragement for when we feel "weak in the heart."

item.title: Moments That Matter Most
item.description: We would do well to slow down a little, focus on the significant, lift up our eyes, and truly see the things that matter most.

item.title: My Duty to God
item.description: Out of love, a 13-year-old boy in Arizona pushed himself to the limit so that his friend, who has cerebral palsy, could participate with him in a triathlon.

item.title: Opportunities to Do Good
item.description: One family's trial becomes a shared blessing for many who serve, love, and bear each other's burdens.

item.title: Practice, Celebration, Dedication: Temple Blessings in El Salvador
item.description: Share in the experience of three Latter-day Saint youth whose hopes are being realized with the dedication of El Salvador’s first temple.

item.title: Same Jersey
item.description: It’s Friday night—the big rivalry game between two Arizona high school football teams. The quarterbacks are opponents tonight, and tomorrow one of them will baptize the other into the Church of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Sanctify Yourselves
item.description: When a little league football player is struck by lightning, his 18-year-old assistant coach must be prepared to use his newly conferred Melchizedek Priesthood authority to call upon the healing powers of heaven.

item.title: Book of Mormon Introduction
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland explains the background and importance of the Book of Mormon. This book is another testament of Jesus Christ and serves as a companion scripture to the Holy Bible.

item.title: The Blessings of Scripture
item.description: As part of the 400th anniversary of the King James Bible, consider our blessings and responsibilities in having God's word so readily available.

item.title: The Civility Experiment
item.description: Learn how civility and kindness go much deeper than appearances and quick judgments. Read President Thomas S. Monson’s full address, “Charity Never Faileth.”

item.title: The Lost Purse
item.description: When a young woman’s purse is left behind after a dance, adult leaders search through it to find the owner’s identity, which is revealed to them in an unexpected way.

item.title: The Miracle of Personal Progress
item.description: By working on their Personal Progress, two young women from Ukraine saw their families’ lives change in ways they had not thought possible.

item.title: The Song of the Heart
item.description: Marissa, a young woman from Hawaii, loves music not only because singing and dancing are her passion but also because music has led her closer to Heavenly Father.

item.title: The Sting of the Scorpion
item.description: A young boy’s encounter with a scorpion in the Arabian desert can teach us a lot about what we must do to avoid and overcome the venomous sting of sin.

item.title: Things as they really are
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar warns of the harmful effects digital technologies can have on our souls and invites us to ask ourselves two questions to see if we are using these technologies properly.

item.title: Unselfish Service
item.description: The Savior has taught us to follow His example and serve others.

item.title: Watch Your Step
item.description: See how a moment’s decision can have far-reaching consequences—for good or bad.

item.title: Wise Men Still Seek Him
item.description: Three modern-day wise men show us that the greatest gift we can give Jesus Christ is the will of our hearts.

item.title: You Will Be Freed
item.description: Through the Atonement of Jesus Christ, all can be transformed, cleansed, and freed from addiction.

item.title: The Laie Hawaii Temple Youth Cultural Celebration
item.description: When the Laie Hawaii Temple reopened after two years of renovations, youth from several islands gathered to celebrate and show their gratitude.

item.title: Families Can Be Together Forever
item.description: Increase your understanding of the Lord’s purpose for families and of the blessings He makes available to them.

item.title: Mormon Mustang
item.description: While flying in a historic airplane, youth learn about the dangers of pushing the envelope.

item.title: The Gila Valley Arizona Temple Celebration
item.description: Youth in the Gila Valley, Arizona, perform in a cultural celebration to express their joy and their faith at the dedication of a new temple for their area.

item.title: Kids and Christmas
item.description: Christmas is a time when we can all learn from a child's gratitude and love for Jesus Christ. See the meaning and the story of Christmas through the eyes of children.

item.title: New Year's: Look Not behind Thee
item.description: Faith in Jesus Christ gives us strength to leave the past behind and look ahead to a brighter future.

item.title: Youth in Action
item.description: A youth group establishes a service club and blesses many people in their community.

item.title: Look to the Light
item.description: At Christmastime and always, Jesus Christ is the Light of the World for all who seek Him.

item.title: A Work in Progress
item.description: His basketball dreams almost didn’t come true, but then Tyler Haws learned where hard work and dedication can lead.

item.title: Within Bounds
item.description: Staying in bounds—on the ski slopes and in life—leads to joy and safety.

item.title: The Greatest Gift
item.description: On Christmas morning, amid presents and torn wrappings, a young man gets a reminder of the greatest gift of all.

item.title: A Priesthood Duty
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson speaks to young people about missionary service—a duty for young men and a rewarding option for young women.

item.title: Thanksgiving Daily
item.description: The more often we see the things around us, the more they become invisible to us. Learn how you can live in thanksgiving daily by noticing the wonders and beauties of this world.

item.title: No Cussing Club
item.description: One boy’s crusade to encourage clean language has far-reaching effects.

item.title: Spiritual Vertigo
item.description: A World War II fighter pilot teaches youth some essential truths to fly by—and to live by.

item.title: Sharing the Light of Christ
item.description: Meet Brandon Jackson, who shared his time and love with orphans in Honduras and discovered what one teenage boy can do for others.

item.title: Reviewing the Lessons of the Past
item.description: Are you preparing for your future? Journey with us as Elder Perry teaches us how to prepare. Read Elder Perry's full address: http://bit.ly/9Ws2qV.

item.title: For Madison
item.description: A group of young women showed their love by doing for a friend what she could not do for herself.

item.title: Continue in Patience
item.description: Patience requires that we obey God's commandments and faithfully wait for His will to be fulfilled.

item.title: The Missing Piece
item.description: Jesus Christ and His gospel help a man find direction amid adversity. Read Elder L. Tom Perry's talk "Let Him Do It with Simplicity."

item.title: Voice of the Spirit
item.description: In a world full of noise and many voices, President James E. Faust invites us to listen to and follow the voice of the Spirit, which is calm and quiet and leads to eternal life.

item.title: Parenting: Touching the Hearts of Our Youth
item.description: Effective parenting means taking the time to listen and to understand the hearts of our children so that we can grow together in faith, friendship, and love.

item.title: Two Brothers Apart
item.description: Follow Luke and Sam over several years as they struggle to understand and connect with each other.

item.title: No Regrets
item.description: A young man from California decided between surfing and seminary—and never looked back.

item.title: Forgiveness: My Burden Was Made Light
item.description: Forgiveness and the power of Jesus Christ enable a man to survive losing his wife and several children in a car accident—and allow the offending driver to begin rebuilding his own life.

item.title: Motherhood: An Eternal Partnership With God
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland shares an encouraging tribute to mothers who, through both challenges and accomplishments, work in partnership with God to raise His children.

item.title: Easily Guided
item.description: This world champion has learned how to let God take the reins.

item.title: Good Things to Come
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland recalls his days as a poor young father with a broken-down family car and testifies that for those who embrace the gospel of Jesus Christ, there are better days and good things to come.

item.title: Fathers and Sons
item.description: A young man in Nevada applied the counsel given by Elder M. Russell Ballard of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles and changed his relationship with his father forever.

item.title: Mothers and Daughters
item.description: Young women in Alberta, Canada, talk about why their mothers are such good examples for them. Elder M. Russell Ballard teaches about the blessings and importance of the special relationship between mothers and daughters.

item.title: Until We Meet Again
item.description: Thomas S. Monson, prophet of the Lord Jesus Christ, shares the touching story of a mother who lost her son at war but learned that he would live again because of our Savior, Jesus Christ.

item.title: My New Life
item.description: Watch and share a new Mormon Messages video, “My New Life,” to see the inspiring story of a woman who not only survived a serious accident but is now a thriving example of courage, love, and faith in Jesus Christ, through whom all is well.

item.title: The Magnificent Priesthood
item.description: Brother David L. Beck highlights the blessings that come when each young man learns and does his duty.

item.title: Return to Virtue
item.description: Elaine S. Dalton, a leader of the Young Women organization, urges young people to develop the strength that comes from living a virtuous life.

item.title: Significant In Every Way
item.description: Experience what it feels like for a young woman to know her true significance.

item.title: Our True Identity
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf retells the story of the ugly duckling and urges us to reflect on who we really are—sons and daughters of a glorious Heavenly Father.

item.title: Charity: An Example of the Believers
item.description: A group of young women reach out in kindness and charity to a student with a disability, fulfilling her dream and giving everyone something to cheer about. To read more about this inspiring example, visit: http://bit.ly/a5AjWz

item.title: Answers to Life's Great Questions
item.description: The teachings of Jesus Christ provide answers to life's great questions.

item.title: Finding Happiness
item.description: The gospel of Jesus Christ provides peace and happiness.

item.title: The Christmas Spirit
item.description: A young girl with true Christmas spirit quietly teaches her preoccupied family the true meaning of Christmas.

item.title: In Sickness and Health
item.description: See how faith and love can remain strong through the challenges and the changing seasons of our lives.

item.title: In the Spirit of Thanksgiving
item.description: Random people on the streets of New York City share a variety of grateful responses to one simple question: What are you thankful for?

item.title: Lifting Burdens
item.description: Apostles of Jesus Christ testify of the Savior's power to heal, change, and purify us through His Atonement.

item.title: Choose This Day
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring, a disciple of Jesus Christ, urges us to seek God's help to overcome complacency and discouragement and find joy in serving Him today.

item.title: The Power of Hope
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf, an Apostle of the Lord Jesus Christ, shares how hope encourages and inspires us to place our trust in the loving care of our Heavenly Father and His Son, Jesus Christ.

item.title: What Matters Most
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson counsels us to spend time with, cherish, and express love to the people we hold dear.

item.title: You're Never Alone
item.description: A disciple of Jesus Christ, Elaine S. Dalton, describes how a grueling marathon taught her about prayer and the strength we can receive from God.

item.title: The Women in Our Lives
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley honors the divine gifts possessed by women and testifies of their importance in God's plan.

item.title: Counsel to Youth
item.description: Boyd K. Packer, an apostle of the Lord Jesus Christ, teaches youth to find happiness through family, thrift, education, purity, good friends, and faith in the Atonement of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Pioneers
item.description: Dallin H. Oaks, Apostle of the Lord Jesus Christ, pays tribute to modern-day pioneers who faithfully follow Jesus Christ.

item.title: Marriage and Divorce
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks testifies that the Atonement of Jesus Christ can heal the pain of a troubled or broken marriage for all who humbly seek His help.

item.title: The Freedom To...
item.description: Elder F. Enzio Busche teaches that the term "freedom" does not simply imply things that we are free from, but those things that we are free to do and accomplish. Choice and agency is freedom.

item.title: A Father Indeed
item.description: The story of a committed husband and father who consistently and passionately demonstrates his love and devotion to his wife and kids.

item.title: Let Us Be Men
item.description: A true man makes sacrifices in order to honor his commitments.

item.title: Trusting in the Lord
item.description: Jennifer talks about how her life has changed for the better as she has learned to trust in the Lord, particularly through her trials and challenges.

item.title: O Remember, Remember
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring encourages us to look for the hand of God and recognize the abundant blessings God gives to us daily.

item.title: Hope Ya Know, We Had a Hard Time
item.description: Elder Quentin L. Cook testifies that the Atonement of Jesus Christ can help us pass through the challenges and trials of this life with hope and assurance in God's love for us.

item.title: Blessings of the Priesthood
item.description: The priesthood is the power of God, which is given to man to act in His name.

item.title: Happy Mother's Day, Mom!
item.description: Youth wish a happy Mother's Day to the women they love and appreciate most in their lives.

item.title: Virtue: For Such a Time as This
item.description: Young women of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints call for a return to virtue and share their commitment to live virtuous and exemplary lives in order to influence the world for good.

item.title: How Can I Find Happiness?
item.description: Elder Scott explains that as you continue to center your mind and heart in the Lord, He will help you have a rich and full life no matter what happens in the world around you.

item.title: None Were with Him
item.description: One of the great consolations of this Easter season is that because Jesus walked such a long, lonely path utterly alone, we do not have to do so.

item.title: You Know Enough
item.description: Our spiritual journey is the process of a lifetime.

item.title: The Blessings of the Temple
item.description: The blessings of the temple enable us to be sealed (connected) to our families after death and return back to the presence of our Father in Heaven.

item.title: Are We Christians?
item.description: Elder Gary J. Coleman speaks of his conversion, understanding of the true nature of the Godhead, access to additional scripture and revelation, and partaking of the blessings of priesthood authority.

item.title: Create
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf invites us to rely on the Spirit and use our divinely inherited ability to create things of substance and beauty.

item.title: How Do I Love Thee?
item.description: Elder Holland gives a powerful talk about how you can better show love for your friends, family, dates or spouse by following the example of Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Only True God and Jesus Christ Whom He Has Sent
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland testifies of the Savior and what it means to be Christian.

item.title: Gordon Hinckley: Lessons I Learned as a Boy
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley recalls a story of an older boy and his young companion as they find an old coat and a badly worn pair of shoes by the roadside.

item.title: Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin Tribute
item.description: Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin, the oldest member of the Church's Quorum of the Twelve Apostles, died on December 1, 2008, at age 91.
